comment: This course was made to be way more difficult than it actually should be. Too much information to try to memorize for exams and you are never allowed to use your notes from the text. You are monitored on a webcam for some quizzes and all exams.

Good professor, knowledgeable and genuinely wants you to succeed. Quizzes are due Sunday nights and there are 3 total tests, including the final. ATTENDANCE IS A HUGE PART OF YOUR GRADE. Show up to class, focus on the underlined terms in her lectures, and you'll pass with an A.

Dr. Barnes is knowledgeable, patient, and specific in her lectures. She uses clear wording on the slides and underlines key words. All tests have a study guide that you get like 2 weeks before the exam. Chapter quizzes due Sunday nights and hybrid work on Fridays. She remained entirely impartial and did not show any bias towards candidates! 10/10
She is so great! Her lectures are very intriguing and the content is super interesting! Not many tests at all, but does require reading the textbook!!!

She was a super easy teacher. You are graded on attendence so make sure you go to class. Theres a movie paper at the end of the semester that has clear grading criteria. She is very heavy with the tests so pay attention in class. I only got a B because I slacked and never studied (but I still made a B, so do with that what you will)

She is a wonderful professor! She truly cares about us and makes an effort to get to know us! I only got a B bc I was stupid and kind of slacked off in that class but if you truly paid attention, you would be just fine. LOVE her lectures btw! It's very engaging bc she makes it very relatable. Is a tough grader, I will say that. Take her class!
Dr. Barnes is friendly, but her lectures and her test was always heavy. But she was good at letting people take their time at taking notes for the class.

Dr. Barnes is a very clear lecturer. Attendance is mandatory and very necessary if you want an A. Her study guides are super helpful, everything that's on there will be on the test and she gave great feedback on the one paper she assigned.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Barnes was a great professor! She answered emails relatively fast. However, she went through her lecture slides very fast. And as much as I studied for her tests, they were always really hard and worded very strange. I was never good at politic type things, but I did learn a lot from this course. Just be ready to STUDY.
Good course and good teacher.

I recommend Dr.Barnes. She makes learning simple and explains very well. Attendance is mandatory, but her class is great! Participation matters, and the quizzes and exams are easy if you study. She creates study guides that help you succeed, and only one essay is required.

Loved her class, its super easy if you pay attention to lectures and show up to class. Show up to class! She docks off points if you miss days. Tests and quizzes are also super easy too. There's only about 2 papers that you have to write, but explains them very well! Also take advantage of her extra credit when she gives them (rare). 9/10!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: As a freshman taking this course Dr.Barnes was a pretty good professor, tries to remember all students names if you are late to class you can still get credit for attending. There is a quiz every week lockdown browser without webcam, goes over all material in class and offers to explain anything that may be on the 3 exams.

This prof. was good at teaching the content, but was extremely strict on minuscule stuff like wording, spelling, and did not provide rubrics for assignments. She took off way too many points for small stuff, kinda like she wanted you to struggle in the course. You have to put in 100 and 10 percent all the time if you even want a low A.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Barnes is great! She clearly is passionate about what she teaches and tries her best to pass that passion onto her students. Attendance is 10% of your grade so show up. Easy quizzes and easy tests (if you study).

AMAZING professor. She is very interactive with her lectures and uses real world examples to help her students better understand her content. She does an amazing job at explaining everything thoroughly.

Pretty good prof. She does call role every single day because attendance is for a grade. PPT lectures every day. Easy quizzes, no homework, but tests are very hard. She gives an extremely vague outline of the test, and most of the test wasn't even on her "study guide." She's really nice but a tough grader.

Dr. Barnes is bad af. She's so gorgeous. She's really passionate and knowledgable about her teaching. Exams and attendance are very important. Tries to get to know you she's a really great professor and person but she has rules and is no lenient about them.

Dr. Barnes is the best! She is tough because she expects upper level effort. Her criteria is clear. The 2 tests and 2 quizzes are a bit tricky but if you study the study guide you can get an A. She uses mc, matching, t/f, and short answer. If you pay attention and study you can get an A. She is awesome and her lectures are fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Barnes led an amazing class. She seems very passionate and interested in her lectures. Attendance, however, WILL make or break you. Overall, the quizzes are easy, the exams a little difficult, and there is only one paper for the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Barnes is very knowledgable and cares about her students getting involved in politics. The content you learn is very important and applicable in the real world. There isn't a lot of homework but make sure you study for the tests and use the study guide.
Nice
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Barnes was just okay for me. Attendance is mandatory as well as speaking in class. She gives very informational lectures which was nice, but she is a tough grader. I believe I wrote one of the best papers of my life and she picked out every small detail she didn't like.

honestly her class was not easy as I said its average. but she's not very lenient or understanding. I got covid right after the first exam and it lasted awhile to the point I had to miss the second exam and she did not let me make it up even though I had sent her weekly updates and pdfs of my pcr tests which I took once a week for school and work.

I loved Dr. Barnes! Her lectures are really engaging and she incorporates a lot of activities in throughout the class as well. Her tests can be a little tricky but if you actually do the readings you should be fine. She's great!

Overall great teacher with pretty interesting lectures. The only thing I would warn people about is her tests they are INCREDIBLY difficult. She gives out study guides but they are broad definitions that you need to know every detail about to pass. There are only 3 tests total, 14 quizzes (very simple), and 1 paper. You have to go to class to pass!

Dr. Barnes is so amazing!! Her lectures are very educational and useful for tests. Her tests can be a little tricky, but you won't fail. Attendance is graded, so show up! Also, definitely read the textbook. Each chapter there will be a quiz on the chapter (those aren't hard). Overall: 3 tests (including final), about 10 quizzes, and one paper (easy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Overall Dr Barnes is a good teacher. She goes over any material that is tested over and she posts the power points on d2l. She is a little tough on grading. Just make sure you attend class and take notes. As far as assignments there is a quiz on almost every chapter at the end of the week, one paper, and a presentation over a current event.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Love Dr. Barnes! She tries to make class interesting which I appreciate. Not much reading which is super nice! Do take a lot of notes! Everything we test on she has gone over and she post the notes after she reviews them. Overall solid choice if you want a decent chance at getting an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: In her online "Race, Gender, and Politics of Difference" course, she had weekly discussion posts based off the week's lecture and readings. These posts got exhausting over time because they felt like busy work. Overall, she knows a lot about the topics and gives comprehensive feedback. I feel she might do better in an in-person situation.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Barnes is the toughest grader, she will look at every single detail. Do not ask about extra credit or rounding grades. She doesnt do it. Posts are like mini essays. Quiz and tests material are based on readings from authors more than content. Shes nice but honestly alittle extra.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Barnes is a really good professor. She tries to interact with the class to make sure we understand what's being discussed. Tests are weighted a lot and so is attendance. It's honestly an easy class, you have one paper that isn't hard at all. She's also understanding. If you're going to miss class or turn something in late, tell her ASAP!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria
